alert.note: Alert for Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 12:39AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Northumberland, northwestern Richmond and southeastern Westmoreland Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 1238 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montross, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montross, Kinsale, Newland, Coles Point, Hague, Westmoreland, Lerty, Currioman Landing, Mount Holly, Stratford Hall, Sandy Point, Erica, Piney Grove, Kremlin, Westmoreland State and Templeman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
